column4: ...so the only way to get to use kde is to delete ubuntu and install kubunto?
I have both kubuntu and ubuntu installed on my computer
so you can't have gnome and kde on the same ubuntu?
Yes you can, kubuntu is KDE for ubuntu, you can't run them at the same time
then why do you have ubuntu and kubuntu installed if you can have them both on 1 ubuntu installation
Kubuntu is KDE, ubuntu is Gnome.
They're not 2 separate operating systems, their the same core operating system with the gnome or kde suite of applications and windows management setup installed.
but lotusleaf said you can have blackbox, fluxbox, openbox, xfce, enlightenment and others on one ubuntu
i know that they're 2 different graphical thingies, but you're really confusing me now
ok, then why do YOU have kubuntu and ubuntu installed if you can use both on one installation?
Kubuntu and ubuntu are not separate OS's, I installed ubuntu (which is gnome) and then typed sudo apt-get kubuntu-desktop
ok, but before you said you dual boot kubuntu and ubuntu
no, I never said I dual boot. =)

u said "<xipietotec> Fenix-Dark: I have both kubuntu and ubuntu installed on my computer"  i thought ubuntu and kubuntu are 2 separate operating systems, one with kde and one with gnome?  how can you run two separate operating systems at once?
you're confusing the hell out of me, i'm gonna skip *buntu and install slackware
Errr.....ubuntu is much much easier to install and configure than slackware
